description: An annual publication about fencing and dueling.  There are many good illustrations which describe proper technique and form.

name.str_pl: issues of Duelist's Annual

variants.description: An annual publication about fencing and dueling.  There are many good illustrations which describe proper technique and form.

name.str_pl: copies of Fencer's Start-Up

variants.description: A beginner's guide to traditional and sport fencing - rules, proper defense and offense, movement, etc.

name.str_pl: copies of Learning Fencing

variants.description: A childish book about fencing, where the mascot Foily guides the reader through the different nuances of fencing with lots of photos and images.

name.str_pl: copies of The Complete Guide to Fencing

variants.description: A thick book, written by professional fencers, that covers every possible aspect of modern sport fencing.

name.str_pl: copies of Fencing: Skills, Tactics, Training

variants.description: A textbook for fence instructors that fulfills every aspect a fencer must know, from the very basics to a master level, from theory to drill training exercises.

name.str_pl: copies of Modern Saber Fencing

variants.description: This book highlights the modern technologies used in fencing, with new possible techniques and scientific research that underlies the latest training methods.

name.str_pl: copies of Fencing: A Renaissance Treatise

variants.description: An ancient treatise explaining the fundamental ideas of fencing that are still used today - distance, time, line, blade opposition, counterattacks, countertime, etc.

description: A hefty military field manual about bayonet usage and combat theory.

name.str_pl: copies of FM 23-25 Army bayonet manual

variants.description: A hefty military field manual about bayonet usage and combat theory.

name.str: The Halberd and Other European Pole Arms, 1300-1650
name.str_pl: copies of The Halberd and Other European Pole Arms, 1300-1650

variants.description: Small, but comprehensive introduction to the pole arms of medieval Europe: from the simple pike, through the halberd in its many forms, to the roncone, bardiche, and many others.

name.str: Boarders Away: With Steel-Edged Weapons and Polearms
name.str_pl: copies of Boarders Away: With Steel-Edged Weapons and Polearms

variants.description: An all-encompassing study of naval armament under fighting sail.  This volume covers pikes and fighting blades in use between 1626 and 1826.

name.str_pl: copies of Polearms of Paulus Hector Mair

variants.description: The summarized and preserved experience of Paulus Hector Mair, an ancient German fencing master, using spears, lances, halberds, poleaxes, and similar weapons.

name.str: Hafted Weapons in Medieval and Renaissance Europe
name.str_pl: copies of Hafted Weapons in Medieval and Renaissance Europe

variants.description: Research about the long history of a huge variety of weapons in medieval times, with lots of illustrations.

name.str_pl: copies of Japanese Spears

variants.description: A fully illustrated guide to the use of polearms, ranging from the earliest halberds and spears reaching Japan from the Asian mainland to the sophisticated naginata, nagamaki, and various forms of yari used by the Japanese samurai through the medieval period.

name.str_pl: copies of Spetsnaz Knife Techniques

description: A classic Soviet text on the art of attacking with a blade.

name.str_pl: copies of Spetsnaz Knife Techniques

variants.description: A classic Soviet text on the art of attacking with a blade.

name.str_pl: copies of Knife Fighting Targets

variants.description: Simple, practical and useful martial art techniques to use in a fight.  On the first page the author says they will not be held responsible for any harm caused by using advice from this book.

name.str_pl: copies of Book of Knives

variants.description: Authored by a state trooper and policeman from Michigan, it contains a lot of experience on real fights with a knife and against a knife.

name.str_pl: copies of The Ka-Bar Knife Combat Manual

variants.description: This manual teaches the reader to use the Ka-Bar, an iconic knife of the U.S. Army that carries the energy and spirit of soldiers.

name.str_pl: copies of Put 'Em Down, Take 'Em Out!

variants.description: "Knife Fighting Techniques From Folsom Prison".  This book describe fighting with a shiv in the tight walls of a jail.

name.str_pl: copies of Queen of Knives

variants.description: A small, femme-oriented manual about self-defense with knife.

name.str_pl: copies of Secrets of the Karambit

variants.description: This book aspires to describe and explain the history, design, materials, and demonstrate deployment and drills with the unusual Indonesian weapon known as the karambit knife.  The final impression is disappointing.

name.str_pl: copies of Combat Knives and Knife Combat

variants.description: A comprehensive compendium about different types of knives and their usage in various martial arts.

name.str_pl: copies of The Silent Bodyguard

variants.description: "The Art of Knife Fencing & the Chronicles of the Modern Fighting Knife and their Wielders".  This book teaches the reader how to defend against an aggressor with various weapons.
